[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CP supports scheduling, feedback, and secure messaging for camp admins, parents, and staff.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The CamperPlus System (CP) defines requirements for camper registration, activity management, and communication.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CP integrates with payment gateways, email, and scheduling tools via secure APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CP provides web and mobile dashboards with role-based access (RBAC).
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CP operates on cloud servers and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: CP connects to encrypted storage and logging services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CP enforces HTTPS, TLS 1.3, and OAuth 2.0.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CP ensures 24/7 uptime with failover support.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CP supports multilingual content and time zones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CP links with emergency and health systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 MISSING-TAG2: CP optimizes storage for large datasets.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CP manages registration, scheduling, attendance, and messaging.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CP requires internet and third-party compliance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: CP serves admins, parents, counselors, and staff.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 MISSING-TAG1: CP follows GDPR, ISO 27001, and secure API protocols.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with payment gateways via OAuth 2.0.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall send encrypted notifications and connect with scheduling APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall enforce API security via rate limiting and IP whitelisting.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow admins to manage campers and activities (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable parents to enroll children securely via MFA.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall track attendance, feedback, and store emergency contacts (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process transactions in 5 seconds and support 1,000 users.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface with SSO.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR and ISO 27001.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt data (AES-256, TLS 1.3) and support failover.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store camper and parent data securely via AES-256.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall maintain schedules and logs with access control.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce RBAC, MFA, and cryptographic logging.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure 99.9% uptime and secure API transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall follow ISO security and event management standards.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Security audits, penetration tests, and compliance validation.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: System architecture, API security policies, and compliance documentation.
